header.$description: Modal header padding (20px). Use for: title area containing heading and close button. Provides generous spacing for the most prominent section.

body.$description: Modal body content padding (20px). Use for: main dialog content area. Matches header padding for visual consistency.

footer.$description: Modal footer padding (16px). Use for: action button container. Slightly tighter than body to visually separate actions from content.

borderRadius.$description: Modal container border radius (16px). Large radius creates a friendly, approachable feel for elevated floating elements. Consistent with card and popover radii.

xs.$description: Extra small modal width (320px). Use for: simple confirmations, yes/no dialogs, brief alerts, delete confirmations. Minimal content, quick decisions.

sm.$description: Small modal width (400px). Use for: simple forms (1-3 fields), prompts with brief input, login dialogs, share dialogs. Limited content that doesn't need much horizontal space.

md.$description: Medium modal width (520px). DEFAULT for most modals. Use for: standard forms, settings panels, detail views, most CRUD operations. Balanced width for typical content.

lg.$description: Large modal width (720px). Use for: complex multi-section forms, comparison views, detailed information display, wizards with multiple columns. Content that benefits from horizontal space.

xl.$description: Extra large modal width (960px). Use for: data-heavy content like tables/grids, image galleries, full document previews, complex configuration panels. Near full-width for maximum content area.

shadow.$description: Modal elevation shadow. Extra large shadow creates strong depth separation from the page content, reinforcing the modal's floating nature and focus-drawing purpose.

opacity.$description: Modal backdrop opacity (60%). Semi-transparent to dim background while keeping it visible for context. Helps users understand the modal is temporary and the main content is still there.

duration.$description: Modal open/close transition duration (200ms). Normal duration provides smooth animation without feeling slow. Fast enough for frequent use, slow enough to be perceived.

enter.$description: Modal entrance easing (ease-out). Decelerates into view - starts fast, slows at end. Creates feeling of the modal 'settling' into place.

exit.$description: Modal exit easing (ease-in). Accelerates out - starts slow, speeds up at end. Creates feeling of the modal being 'dismissed' away.

zIndex.$description: Modal z-index stacking level (400). Higher than most UI elements to ensure modal appears above page content, dropdowns, and tooltips. Below only toast notifications.

fontSize.$description: Modal title font size (18px). Large enough to be clearly visible as the primary heading, but not overwhelming in the confined modal space.

fontWeight.$description: Modal title font weight (600). Semibold provides strong visual hierarchy without the heaviness of bold, appropriate for dialog headings.

lineHeight.$description: Modal title line height (1.25). Tight line height for single-line titles. If titles wrap, this keeps them compact within the header area.
